name: Doodle God
description: Doodle God is an addicting puzzle & world building game where players use logic and ingenuity to create the entire universe. Starting with the basic elements of earth, wind, fire and air players can build a world filled with locomotives, Dragons, skyscrapers, Aliens and more.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7 or higher Processor: AMD Atholon 64 X2 Dual-Core 4000+ or better / Intel Core 2 Duo Processor 2.0GHz or better Memory: 2048 MB RAM Graphics: ATI X1800 or better / nVidia 7800 or better / Intel 4100 or better. 512MB Video RAM DirectX: Version 11 Storage: 1024 MB available space

reviews.review_text: Buy to Play and Microtransactions? Tsssk Tsssk Doodle God.

Having had not played this game before: it's your standard Mobile style time waster, complete with microtransactions. The unfortunate part is that this game is VERY BUGGY, and has crashed on me more times than I can count, in the <45 minutes that I've tried to play it. I've given up on even being able to play this anymore. Save yourself the money and skip this one.

This one was a lame time killer. Basically, you combine two things, and ONLY two things to create new things. The logic of the combos is crap. It is likely the creator thought some of the combos were funny, so that makes one person. You end up just cycling through every combo to unlock more stuff to combine. For the little time I played the game, I can't help but feel that I came out a little dumber. You can get more entertainment, sense of accomplishment, and challenge by breaking out the pumice stone and sanding down the calluses on your feet.

I well good port of the classic mobile hit Doodle God, A logic puzzle to create elements by combining two elements together.  While I won't recommend to the action gamer, if you haven't played the original this game is worth the purchase just to get your brain going to get the combinations.
This started out as a neat concept, but after a while you just do trial and error instead of thinking about what things may go together. Less of a puzzle game and more of a patience game.

This game is pretty simple but it's a good time waster, especially while I'm waiting for patches to other games. I wouldn't recommend this if you're looking for something to keep you occupied for more than an hour or if you're looking for a good adventure, but it's an alright game. I remember playing it when it was free on those old flash game sites, that's really the only reason I bought it. Also the only reason I'm writing this review is because every few combinations they keep PROMPTING ME TO WRITE ONE AND THEY WON'T STOP. so gr8.
Very fun... for free, I mean paying doesn't decrease the amount of fun but if it was cheaper i'm sure i'd enjoy it more.
Very simple game where you combine stuff. That's it. Buy only if you like to do math like 1+1=2 or 2+2=4 so basically if you're like age of four. Just avoid this kind of 'game'.
I dont rly know whats the problem with the game, my game didnt crashed like some people said and i playing for a bit alredy.  Love the game and im happy for the PC Version :)

This is a fun game with a low price. Don't pay for hints and have fun figuring things out. If you feel that you need hints, then don't play this game. You get free hints anyway... I've been playing without hints and it's fun. There are quests and puzzles and more. Try it if you're actually interested and get a refund if you don't like it. I'm having fun with it. It is definiteley a casual game though!

So, lots of people are mad at this game cause of microtransactions. But hey, look carefully at them. You have an option(!) to buy in-game hints, in case you stuck. These hints you get from time to time eventually (and free), you get them as daily rewards (also free) and you can win them in multi-player (also free). Not to mention that you can simply google the Doodle God Wiki and use it to complete the game without any hints. And of course you can actually THINK and complete the game yourself. So, why are these people SO mad? Maybe because they are SO dumb and cannot play puzzle game without hints, which they actually bought? Nobody forces you to buy anything, the game can be freely completed without any additional payments.  Apart from that - its a nice puzzle game with good and sometimes hillarious gameplay. I strongly recommend it to all puzzle-lovers. Cheers.

Great fun, and the game has come a long way since I played the earlier games of Doodle God and Doodle Devil over at Kongregate. A fun game, with a good mix of puzzles and some comedy. You might even learn a thing or two too ;)
It has nice, original and very chill gameplay so if you are an easy entertained gamer, this is the game for you.
I didn't saw any microtransactions in this game, and that's good... Its nice game and addictive, be careful xD
